data.title: Better scrolling
data.body: The engine now uses the SDL2.0 scroll events properly.

data.title: Added "make test" to Windows' make script.
data.body: Fixes #5282.

data.title: OpenRA.Utility --shp does not compress output file
data.body:
Consider this test case:

```
$ ./OpenRA.Utility.exe --extract ts nahand.shp

12K nahand.shp

$ ./OpenRA.Utility.exe --extract ts isotem.pal

768 isotem.pal

$ ./OpenRA.Utility.exe --png nahand.shp isotem.pal

2.7K nahand-0000.png
2.7K nahand-0001.png
2.6K nahand-0002.png
1.2K nahand-0003.png
1.2K nahand-0004.png
1.3K nahand-0005.png

$ ./OpenRA.Utility.exe --shp "naha*.png"

103K nahand.shp
```

The final `nahand.shp` is 103K (144x120 pixels x1 bpp x6 files).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2126366-openra-utility-shp-does-not-compress-output-file?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: sniper shooting over walls
data.body:
now , im aware of the problems with infantry-bullets/jumps/tesla not getting blocked by walls aka.: e1 , dogs , tanya , shok .. but it gets really ridiculous when i cant protect my infantry with walls ... from snipers 

![snip](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2947212/bd487dce-d9f3-11e3-9d56-c0c466822ecb.png)

data.title: Odd scrolling in UI
data.body:
I noticed that scrolling in most UI windows is very slow. The screen moves by only a few pixels at a time. I'd like to fix this as my first contribution, but I would like to first confirm that this is happening on other PCs as well.

Some specific windows to check:
- Extras > Credits
- Extras > Asset Browser
- Multiplayer (this is slightly faster, but I'd like it to factor in your windows scroll settings, if at all possible).

data.title: Cannot Connect to remote server
data.body: I downloaded the openra 20131223 then downloaded it with portable installation. With empty logs I deleted support folder. Still the result is unable to connect to remote server for red alert.

data.title: Fix rock passability in snow, winter, temperat
data.body:
There were some mistakes in passability for some cliffs and a rock. I fixed them in these tilesets.

There are a few "edge cases" where it's ambiguous whether a given tile should be built upon which I didn't touch. If someone is neurotic, they can ask me for screen shots and I'll show them.

Will work on desert next. There are many more mistakes there so it will take longer.

data.title: Selling not updating Building tab
data.body: If you build something with a build limit and then sell it you can't build another building of that type until you've built or sold something else.

data.title: Tech prerequisites are inconsistent
data.body:
#5280 highlighted our weird prerequisite setup:
- The Building trait will grant a prerequisite of the actor's name.
- The ProvidesCustomPrerequisite trait will grant an arbitrarily named prerequisite.

There is no way to automatically grant an actor-type prerequisite for non-buildings, and those prerequisites are granted even when they aren't wanted (civilian structures, everything in D2K).

We should split auto-prereq behavior from Building into its own trait or merge it into ProvidesCustomPrequisite as a default value if the prereq name isn't specified.

data.title: Balance adjust: Return LTNK dmg. vs. wood to 75%
data.body: It seemed that the tanks were inept at hurting buildings and needed a boost. However, after playtesting, it's clear that Nod's flame tank is already exceptional at destroying buildings, and the recon bikes are quite decent at it, too. Thus, the light tank's effectiveness at killing buildings is overlapping with the flame tank (same tech level & cost), making most Nod units effective at hurting buildings. So, I think this is in order to preserve distinct roles among the vehicles.

data.title: Fix strange d2k loading slowness
data.body:
Note: I tracked this down to being a Mono bug that was fixed somewhere between  3.2.8 and 3.4.0. I don't know if you want this merged or not.

There is a strange issue that appears when Theater calls
ISpriteFrame.Frames on the R8Reader. The R8Reader uses
IEnumerable.Cast<> which behaves slower and slower, which
makes map loading become 10+ times slower.

The changes here simply avoid the casting.

data.title: A.I Dividing by zero in Skirmish Game
data.body:
Hello guys!

Just posting here to try and grab some support for a mod I'm working on, while testing the A.I in-game, every single darn time, the A.I places any structure down on the map, the game crashes to desktop. It only happens with the "Allies" Faction, which has been heavily edited as part of my mod, everything works fine for a player, the problem is purely A.I

![exception 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7146407/2938489/970fe880-d90e-11e3-8941-61480d455c03.png)

There is the log, if possible. I'd greatly appreciate a timely reply, as I'm working within a development cycle here and wouldn't like to be held off for very long

data.title: Allow 3 infantry in a pillbox at one time?
data.body: What if we do this? Might make them a bit more useful late game.

data.title: make.ps1 is missing a test command.
data.body: This should do the same thing as `make test`.

data.title: Barracks doesn't build infantry
data.body:
I had a weird bug in Red Alert mod release-20131223. I was building rocket troops, the troops were being built and the unit ready sound is played but no infantry comes out of the barracks. Here is the replay:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzbxfjMhrV6eZWFqdGYwMFp4Nms/edit?usp=sharing

You can see the barracks progress bar complete multiple times around 2:50 but no new unit appears in front of the barracks. I was the red player on top right spot.

data.title: TechTreeTrait system has been made
data.body:
Techlevel UI added
TechLevel UI hidden when no techlevels in mod\nTechlevel dropdown button disabled if only one option

You can make new tech levels with ProvidesTechPrerequisite@TechLevel5:
the ~ annotation hides the item from build queue if prerequisite is not met

Also reworked most of the prereq system so its more flexible and allows a lot of interesting things

data.title: Add news
data.body: This code as-is requires a news yaml file to be present on the OpenRAWeb repo. You can use https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8707714/news.yaml for testing if you need to.

data.title: SAM site on the TD shellmap starts open.
data.body: I'm pretty sure that this is a regression, probably from the garrison-related Attack\* changes.

data.title: Authors file Typo fixed
data.body:
fixes #5276

Spelling error on line 111 of Authors 
intially - Initially

data.title: Typo in 'Authors'
data.body:
Using ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib intially by Mike
Krueger and distributed under the GNU GPL terms.

intially should be Initially

data.title: Renamings and Reorganisation
data.body:
A collection from stuff suggested in IRC. These could be done once the pull request queue is a little less crowded https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5263.
- [x] OpenRA.Support.Random clashes with System.Random https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5359/
- [x] WRange  WDist ~~https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4701~~ https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8667
- [x] OpenRA.Renderer.\* is actually more like OpenRA.Platform.\* because it is graphics + input and could also include OpenRA.Sound which is currently in OpenRA.Game so we save linking to SDL2 there. ~~https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5787~~ ~~https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8538~~ https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8632
- [x] Many traits in OpenRA.Mods.RA should actually be in OpenRA.Mods.Common as they are shared in all three mods. Same goes for system rules every mod needs or shared chrome definitions which could also be moved to `mods/common/` for clarity. ~~https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5321~~ https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6511
- [x] Don't call factions countries or races. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7552

data.title: OpenRA.Thirdparty is now OpenRA.Support
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4843 to unbreak the build.

data.title: Remove magic sprite filename resolution (support TS-style terrain-specific artwork)
data.body:
Automatically resolving extensionless filenames to tileset-specific versions made sense back in 2007, but the engine is now a completely different beast and this now causes more problems than it solves.
- It makes it very difficult to statically verify sequence errors. #2283
- It makes it difficult to effectively cache data to reduce load times (see #5234).
- It's not needed for D2K, which doesn't have tileset-specific art.
- It won't work at all in TS or RA2, which use different names (not just extensions) for tileset-specific art.

We should rip out this legacy code, require mods to define tileset-variants in sequences, and then use name mangling (like we do for damage states) to resolve them in mod-level code.

data.title: Missing prerequisites should be displayed in red in production tooltips.
data.body:
I noticed while playing TD that when you mouseover units in the build queue, it will say something like  "requires communication center" for a tech-2 unit, that even after you build the communication center, that it still says "requires communication center".  Same applies to buildings, saying "requires power plant" and "requires refinery", etc.
I think it should only display the prerequisite information while you are still lacking that prerequisite. (Is this a regression from earlier versions?)

Also, I think the prerequisite info should be in red, since it's telling you that you lack something, and since it's information that's different from other unit information.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2074418-missing-prerequisites-should-be-displayed-in-red-in-production-tooltips?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
